alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 25 at 8:30AM CST until November 25 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Periods of snow. Additional snow accumulations ranging anywhere from a dusting to 3 inches. Highest amounts are expected generally southeast of a line from Hill City to Leoti. * WHERE...Entire Tri-State area. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ Saturday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions associated with accumulating snow on all area roadways. This includes the Interstate 70 corridor in eastern Colorado and northwest Kansas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional light snow accumulation is expected this morning. Snow will end from west to east this afternoon. Easterly winds will remain at or below 10 mph. Blowing and drifting snow are not anticipated. Wind chill readings as low as 8 degrees below zero are expected late tonight into Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and exercise additional caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
